channel.title: A challenge
channel.description: Well as some of you will have seen i have posted a modified ROM in this board and it is GBA, i want to branch out into NDS roms which is no problem to do its just the actual emulator that is a problem. No one has succesfully made a good working NDS emulator they always have errors and major lag issues. I challenge some of the best and brightest people of MITB to make a working NDS emu. If you do decide to do keep things in mind: no NDS emu so far has a frame throttle which gba emus do. No NDS emu has the music working correctly it sort of comes out in a mish mash of the music. Also the emus have problems running the 3d graphics which causes glitches and such.

gl hf making one, it’d take like a year(possibly 5years) for anyone here to make one…

item.title: A challenge
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Nashi, post:2, topic:202338”]Sanga, It’s not a challenge, The people at MITB are liek. WOAH.
They could solve world hunger.

It’s just a matter of whether or not they feel like it[/quote]
Lol solve world hunger i think its different to PSP because like i said there are attempts to make a good emu but the bugs are all in the way and the music and the lack of a throttle make them not very good :S

Read full topic

item.title: A challenge
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

Yar I’d be interested in seeing how it would work but I don’t know how I could help =[

Read full topic

item.title: A challenge
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I’d be interested in writing one, but I have very limited experience with virtualization and emulation. First off, I don’t even own a DS, nor know anything about the hardware (specifically the CPU). If it’s anything like how the PSP works, there’d be a hell of a lot of stuff to reimplement and reverse engineer.

Read full topic
